content: are you a pin addict wondering what to do with them when you re not wearing them with this crochet pin banner / pennant pattern you can enjoy them every day the great thing about a crochet banner is that the holes are built in by design so no wrecking the material with the pointy bits like on some fabric banners skill level this is a super simple quick and easy pattern using single_crochet us and a few slip stitches perfect for a beginner materials this uses a relatively small amount of yarn - around 50g of worsted weight in the item pictured the pattern will work with any yarn thought so this is ideal for stash busting for the bar i used a chopstick but a knitting needle doweling or a stick would work make great options sizing the item pictured measures 9in wide by 14 in long from tip to tab but it is very easy to resize to suite your need gauge is not important but the stitches should be made fairly tight so the weight of the pins does not distort the shape of the flag i hope you enjoy this pattern and as always don t forget to tag me in your finished makes i d love to see your projects here on ravelry or other socials on instagram you can use the hashtag #hookmehappy or just tag @ doradexplored 1 you can tweet me your pictures or add your them to my facebook page 2 and if socials aren t your thing feel free to email me your efforts it really does make my day i m also a huge fan of pinterest 3 so if you like my patterns i d love it if you pin them or visit my pinterest page 4 which showcases some wonderful inspirational crochet patterns the talent out there blows my mind until next time happy hooking dx c doradoes 2018 you may sell what you make from my patterns but please credit me as the designer the pattern is for personal use only and may not be shared my photos may be shared with credit 1 https //www instagram com/doraexplored/ 2 https //www facebook com/craftedbydora/ ref=bookmarks 3 https //www pinterest co uk/doraexplored/boards/ 4 https //www pinterest co uk/doraexplored/boards/
